'''Anna Ternheim''' (born 31 May 1978) is a Swedish singer-songwriter.

==Early life==
Ternheim was born 31 May 1978 in [[Stockholm]], Sweden. When she was 10 years old she began playing the guitar, writing songs and performing. During a year abroad in [[Atlanta]], Georgia, Anna created her first band "Sova", playing at smaller festivals and local clubs. Back in Stockholm she continued her song writing and later in [[Lausanne]], [[Switzerland]], where she was performing while studying French.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.sing365.com/music/lyric.nsf/Anna-Ternheim-Biography/D5A0FEE8E4DB81994825702900114EDA |title=Anna Ternheim Biography |accessdate=19 December 2010 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111031181024/http://www.sing365.com/music/lyric.nsf/Anna-Ternheim-Biography/D5A0FEE8E4DB81994825702900114EDA |archivedate=31 October 2011  }} Anna Ternheim Biography</ref>

==Career==
She released her debut album ''[[Somebody Outside]]'' in 2004.<ref>{{cite web|url={{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p738528|pure_url=yes}}|title=Biography: Anna Ternheim|last=Reges|first=Margaret |publisher=[[Allmusic]]|accessdate=15 April 2010}}</ref> The Swedish Grammy jury awarded her the Best Newcomer of the Year award, and she was nominated for Best Female Artist, Best Lyricist and Best Songwriter in 2005. She also won the P3 Gold award for Best Newcomer 2004.{{cn|date=August 2020}}

For her second album, ''[[Separation Road]]'' released on 27 September 2006, she was awarded Best Female Artist and Best Lyricist by the Swedish Grammy jury.  Again she was nominated for Best Songwriter and Best Album. She received the award for Best Female Artist at the Swedish National Radio's P3 Gold Awards the same year.{{cn|date=August 2020}}

Her debut US album, ''Halfway to Fivepoints'', was released on 22 April 2008.{{cn|date=August 2020}}

In 2008, Ternheim moved to Manhattan, where she has lived ever since.<ref name="ard">{{Cite news |title=Video: Talk: Anna Ternheim  |language=de |work=- Morgenmagazin – ARD, Das Erste |url=https://www.daserste.de/information/politik-weltgeschehen/morgenmagazin/videos/talk_anna_terheim_-100.html |access-date=5 August 2020}}</ref>

Her fourth album, ''[[Leaving on a Mayday]]'', was released on 11 August 2008. The album won Album of the Year at the 2009 Swedish Grammy Awards along with the award for Best Female Artist.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.annaternheim.com/?sid=article&pid=read&id=11578|title=Best female artist & Album of the year, Grammy Awards|publisher=Anna Ternheim|accessdate=18 August 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100812134047/http://www.annaternheim.com/?sid=article&pid=read&id=11578| archivedate= 12 August 2010 | url-status= live}}</ref>

''[[The Night Visitor (album)|The Night Visitor]]'', Ternheim's fifth studio album, was released in autumn 2011 in both the United States and international territories.{{cn|date=August 2020}} 

After a series of performances and a brief break from touring, Ternheim announced on her blog in April 2015 recording sessions for a new album or [[Extended play|EP]], based from the Figure 8 Recording studio in [[Brooklyn]], New York.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Ternheim |first1=Anna |title=FIGURE 8 RECORDING |url=http://www.annaternheim.com/2015/04/24/figure-8-recording/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150517071729/http://www.annaternheim.com/2015/04/24/figure-8-recording/ |url-status=dead |archive-date=17 May 2015 |website=annaternheim.com |publisher=self-published |accessdate=4 July 2015 }}</ref>

==Discography==
[[File:Anna Ternheim live-2.jpg|thumb|right|Ternheim in 2009]]
Her most popular songs include: "To Be Gone", "My Secret", "Girl Laying Down", "Today is A Good Day", and "Shoreline" (a [[Broder Daniel]] cover).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.last.fm/music/Anna+Ternheim/+charts|title=Anna Ternheim's Charts – Last.fm: Anna Ternheim |publisher=CBS Interactive Music Group|accessdate=18 August 2010}}</ref>
===Albums===
*2004 – ''Somebody Outside''
*2006 – ''[[Separation Road]]''
*2008 – ''Halfway to Fivepoints'' (US only)
*2008 – ''[[Leaving on a Mayday]]''
*2011 – ''[[The Night Visitor (album)|The Night Visitor]]''
*2015 – ''For the Young''
*2017 – ''All the Way to Rio''
*2019 – ''A Space for Lost Time''

===Live albums===
*2016 – ''Live in Stockholm''
*2018 – ''The Winter Tapes''

===EPs===
*1996 – ''Sova''
*2003 – ''Anna Ternheim'' – demo
*2004 – ''I'll Follow You Tonight''
*2004 – ''To Be Gone''
*2005 – ''My Secret''
*2005 – ''Shoreline''
*2006 – ''Girl Laying Down''
*2007 – ''Lovers Dream & More Music for Psychotic Lovers''
*2007 – ''Anna Ternheim''
*2008 – ''Halfway to Fivepoints'' (US only)
*2012 – ''Anna & Ferg'' (with David Ferguson)
*2006 – ''Gifts of Changes''

===Singles===
*2004 – "To Be Gone"
*2005 – "My Secret"
*2005 – "Shoreline"
*2006 – "Girl Laying Down"
*2007 – "Today Is a Good Day"
*2008 – "What Have I Done"
*2009 – "Escape Into My Arms"
*2009 – "No, I don't Remember"
*2009 – "Make It On My Own"
*2012 – "Walking Aimlessly"
*2012 – "Lorelie-Marie"
*2013 – "Shoreline (Horns & Saw Version)"
*2013 – "Light of Day"
*2015 – "Every Heartbeat"
*2015 – "Still A Beautiful Day"
*2015 – "For The Young"
*2015 – "Caroline"
*2016 – "Kärleken Väntar"
*2017 – "Minns Det Som Igår"

===Guest appearances===
*2007 – ''Leave a Light'' on Voices of Eden by Fläskkvartetten
*2007 – ''Reflexion 07'' on Reflexion 07 by Petter
*2009 – ''Du Och Jag'' and  ''Christmas'' on The Dark Flower (Den Mörka Blomman) by Freddie Wadling
*2010 – ''Spår'' on Spår by Tomas Andersson Wij
*2012 – ''Quiet Night'' on Wallander – The Music by Fleshquartet
*2013 – ''Seventeen (Alternative Version)'' on Seventeen by Johnossi
*2014 – ''Lovers Never Say Goodbye'' on The Time Has Come by Weeping Willows
*2015 – ''Far From Any Road'' on Ghost Rider by Jerry Williams

===Songs in popular culture===
{{unreferenced section|date=August 2020}}
In 2010 her song "My Heart Still Beats for You" featured on season 7 of The CW's One Tree Hill.
Her song "What Have I Done" was featured on the popular drama series "Grey's Anatomy".

The Ternheim song "Quiet Night" was used in the second series of the Swedish version of ''[[Wallander (Swedish TV series)|Wallander]]'' starring [[Krister Henriksson]]. On 18 December 2009, her song "No, I Don't Remember" was featured on an episode of ''[[Dollhouse (TV series)|Dollhouse]]'' entitled "The Attic". This song was featured in July 2010 on a new DLC episode, for the [[Xbox 360]] videogame [[Alan Wake]], entitled "The Signal". The songs "Off the Road" and "Words of Love" also featured in the videogame [[Silent Hill: Downpour]].
